short-description: If allowed in the rules these solid aluminum engine and transmission mounts offer many advantages over a urethane or Delrin mounts. short-description: Don't neglect your motor mounts! Most stock BMW motor mounts are fluid filled and the stiffness of the mount depends on this fluid. But over time the fluid leaks out and the strength of the mount is greatly reduced. A worn motor mount allows the engine to twist and shift around. The harder you're driving the more shift will occur. As the engine is moving around it can contact other parts in the engine bay - usually cooling related. The mechanical fan can hit the radiator; the A/C compressor can hit a radiator hose, the exhaust will flex and may break. Twisting of the engine can also lead to shifting problems as the transmission twists with it. There are countless issues related to worn or compressed motor mounts so don't overlook these as a regular replacement item (every 50,000 miles).

short-description: This is the factory BMW Motorsport Group N motor mount for the E30 M3. When the factory wanted to upgrade their motor mounts, this was the solution! The stock S14 motor mount is filled with fluid and a relatively soft rubber compound. This was designed to absorb vibration from the high strung S14 engine. But during hard track use the stock motor mounts can become a liability with the engine twisting and shifting around. BMW Motorsport's solution was to design a mount that is not fluid filled and solid rubber. The Group N mounts are 20% stiffer than the stock mounts which makes them perfect for weekend fun cars, autocross, and even light track use. Because it lacks a fluid for dampening, more vibration will make its way into the car. These mounts are the same height as the original stock mounts. Pricey? Maybe. But these are factory Motorsport parts that work as advertised. These motor mounts are widely regarded as among the best on the market for a motor mount upgrade. Combine these with the Group N transmission mounts for a matched set.   When doing any sort of repair or maintenance there is no replacement for genuine factory parts.
